text: this may have just been slack but ensure the H is not capitalized.
Also you may want to specifiy a destination to place those folders locally
if someone could share a link to the gulp setup that they use that is faster, i'd be curious to see it
fwiw, we are working on <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react-boilerplate> and have tossed around the idea of a more generic theme boilerplate that doesn't include react but does have a build step
i am sure that <@U7UBMQMDK> <@U26B530N6> and <@UTBPD56E9> would be curious to hear ideas around what folks would find most useful

My main project this week has been creating our own agency starter repo and documenting our workflow for local dev. We are taking an iterative approach, but our primary goals are to use SCSS and PostCSS for all CSS assets across the theme folder, built-in image optimization for theme assets, and have all JS run through babel so we can use ES6 and still support our standard browser set. We are going to be experimenting with what our ideal output will look like, but a top priority for us now is getting our developers the tools they want.
